answers.answer: Do you mean sugar?  If so, sugar is never good in a urine sample.  This means that your body is not able to absorb and process all the sugar you consume, so the excess spills into your urine.  Are you diabetic?  If you are not, and you are pregnant, this could be a sign of gestation diabetes.  What did the doctor say to you? Was he/she concerned?

I had sugar in my urine especially with my 2nd pregnancy I had it once with my first and ended up getting gestational diabetes both times but I think its quite common to get a trace of sugar in your urine during pregnancy I found when I ate grapes I threw sugar fingers crossed its not gd but it can be controlled as I know.

question: what does it mean when you have surger in your urine i went to the DR and i had 100 surger kindof woundering what this means
title: surger in urine
